comments:
If you start the Web service wizard using a blank workspace and a Web service
runtime that supports EARs, the EAR project field is empty. In the case of
client creation, I can actually click Finish on the Object Selection Page but
am blocked when I get to page 3 by the blank EAR field. If I do click Finish,
no EAR is created and no error occurs.

After letting the wizard finish, I noticed that more projects than I expected
are in fact created:

WebServiceProject
WebServiceClientEAR
WebServiceClientEARProject

and an NPE occurs:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

The EAR project containing the EAR component is WebServiceClientEAR. I don't
know what WebServiceClientEARProject is but it looks like an empty flexible
project.

Rupam, let's consider this one for M6. Trouble can be avoided by going to page 
3 and filling in an EAR, but this seems an unrealistic expection for casual 
users, and a trap that most folks will fall into and get very irritated about.

I took a look at the code, and the current behaviour as a result of it.  The 
fix looks clean and behaves well with a Generic WAS v6 server.
